definition: at or in the very same.../suitable/adequate/fitting/proper/to replace/to regard as/to think/to pawn/(coll.) to fail (a student)
to be/to act as/manage/withstand/when/during/ought/should/match equally/equal/same/obstruct/just at (a time or place)/on the spot/right/just at

sentences.english: I heard the clank of buckets as the farm workers went to milk the cows.
sentences.chinese: 我听到农场工人去挤牛奶时牛奶桶发出的当啷声。
然后，当啷，你一个月2912刀了。

sentences.english: There was a clatter of dishes in the kitchen.
sentences.chinese: 厨房里传来盘子的当啷声。
然后，当啷，你一个月1456刀了。

sentences.english: The door opened with a heavy clang.
It was dank and clanked; it smelled like history.
sentences.chinese: 那间房子阴湿，当啷作响，散发着历史的气味。

sentences.english: They cover him quickly as the crowbar clangs to the ground.
sentences.chinese: 他们迅速掩盖了洞口，撬棍当啷一声，落在了地上。

sentences.english: She heard the tinkle of the broken lens.
sentences.chinese: 她听到透镜当啷一声撞碎了。

sentences.english: The doors and windows rattled all night.
sentences.chinese: 门窗丁零当啷地响了一夜。

sentences.english: With a clatter, the flatterer shattered the chattering wattmeter in the chaos.
sentences.chinese: 当啷一声，马屁精在混乱中打碎了格格作响的瓦特表。

sentences.english: She clashed the pan down on the stone floor.
sentences.chinese: 锅当啷一声掉在石头地板上。

sentences.english: The prisoner's chains clanked as he walked.
sentences.chinese: 囚犯行走时，铁链当啷作响。

sentences.english: He dropped the knife and it clattered on the stone floor.
sentences.chinese: 他一失手，刀子当啷一声掉到石头地面上。

sentences.english: His hand went limp and the knife clattered to the ground.
sentences.chinese: 他的手一软，刀子当啷一声掉到地上。

definition: (onom.) sound of a crash/with a crash
with a crash/with a thunderous noise
(onom.) sound of object falling into water/plop
(onom.) scraping sound/ripping of fabric/screeching of tires
